title: Bug 49299 - Incorrect behavior with custom cookie name and URL rewriting
description: In chapter 7.1.1 of servlet30finalspec.pdf, it is stated that if a web application configures a custom name for its session tracking cookies, the same custom name will be used as the name of the URI parameter if the sessionid is encoded in the URL (assuming URL rewriting is enabled). However, the actual behavior does not match this description.
OB:
When accessing the page at http://localhost:8080/cookiename/index.jsp, the following cookie is set:

Set-Cookie: MYSESSIONCOOKIE=658C60E714E9C7C833F4FDA366E0477F; Path=/cookiename; HttpOnly

But the Reload link on the page uses 'jsessionid', resulting in the URL: http://localhost:8080/cookiename/index.jsp;jsessionid=658C60E714E9C7C833F4FDA366E0477F4.
EB: The expected behavior is that the Reload link should use the custom cookie name, resulting in the URL: http://localhost:8080/cookiename/index.jsp;MYSESSIONCOOKIE=658C60E714E9C7C833F4FDA366E0477F.
